most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code

common_issues.title: Pieces OS/Desktop Startup Failure After Update
common_issues.description: Users are unable to launch Pieces Desktop after updating Pieces OS. The app gets stuck on "Ensure Core Dependencies" screen.  Pieces OS service appears to hang. Reinstalling doesn't resolve the problem.  Issue affects both Windows and macOS and may involve data corruption or leftover files from previous installations.  Logs indicate potential service connection failures. Further investigation needed to pinpoint root cause and provide a fix. Workarounds may include clearing all Pieces data/configurations.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
related_issues.text: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update. stucks at loading ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1.0 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. For over a month I have been unable to use **Pieces OS** or **Pieces Desktop**. The Pieces OS service stopped working (I assume after the last update), and since then the desktop app no longer starts properly. Whenever I try to launch, the `Pieces` process starts but never progresses further. In **Pieces Desktop** I only see the message: _Ensure Core Dependencies Retry Step_ I’ve seen another user reporting a similar issue, but my case seems different (I’m attaching logs below). Unfortunately, this is not the first time I’ve faced problems with Pieces.... I’ve already lost all my history/snippets about three times in the past (distinct bugs). This situation is quite frustrating. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Install/update to the latest version of Pieces OS on Windows 11. 2. Launch Pieces Desktop. 3. Observe that the app does not open and gets stuck with the “Ensure Core Dependencies” message. ### Expected Behavior Pieces OS should start normally and allow Pieces Desktop to connect and function. ### Actual Behavior - Pieces OS process starts but hangs. - Pieces Desktop shows “Ensure Core Dependencies – Retry Step”. - Reinstalling from scratch does not solve the issue. ### System Information - **OS**: Windows 11 - **Processor**: Intel x64-based - **Pieces OS**: 12.2.1.0 - **Pieces Desktop**: 4.34 ### Troubleshooting Attempted - Tried reinstalling Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop from scratch → issue persists. - I noticed a similar issue has been reported, but I’m not sure it is directly related to what I’m experiencing. - I suspect that completely deleting all local data/configuration files could be a final solution, but this would cause me to lose all my snippets/history (which has already happened before). I’d prefer to avoid this unless it’s confirmed as the only fix. ### Logs [Support logs.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22142467/Support.zip) ### Additional... If this issue is already being tracked, that’s fine. If not, I’ll attempt to wipe all Pieces data and retry, though I suspect some leftover files/data may be blocking the reinstall. Thanks in advance for your support! related_issues.title: MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
related_issues.text:
MCP Server SSE Connection Hangs - No Tools Available in Claude Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The Pieces MCP server fails to properly integrate with Claude Code within VSCode. While the SSE endpoint responds initially, it hangs indefinitely, preventing MCP tools from being registered or used. This affects Claude Code integration both as a standalone CLI and when used within VS Code.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install Pieces OS and Pieces app
2. Login in the app
3. Configure MCP in Claude Code's ~/.claude.json:

```json
{
  "pieces": {
    "type": "sse",
    "url": "http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse"
}
```

4. Attempt to use Pieces MCP tools (e.g., mcp__pieces__ask_pieces_ltm) in Claude Code
5. Tools are not available despite server being configured
6. Same issue occurs whether using Claude Code in terminal or integrated with VS Code

**Technical Details:**
- SSE endpoint (http://localhost:39300/model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/sse) responds with:

```
event: endpoint
data: /model_context_protocol/2024-11-05/messages
```

- Connection then hangs indefinitely (SSE buffering issue)
- Both Pieces OS and Pieces app processes are running

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Startup Failures
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS and Desktop app failing to start after updates. Symptoms include the app getting stuck on loading screen, "Ensure Core Dependencies" errors, and Pieces OS service failing.  Troubleshooting steps like reinstalling have not resolved the issue. Potential solutions include checking logs, verifying system compatibility, and ensuring Pieces OS service is running.

related_issues.title: Suspicious Connections
related_issues.text:
Suspicious Connections
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.3.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I’m experiencing frequent and sophisticated attacks on my machine. I’ve reported the issues to Apple using Warp Bot reports, but the device detects “suspicious connections.” I’d like to exclude your software since it’s beneficial for developers, but the attacks are persistent.

I’ve included Warp Bot’s findings and sent them to Apple’s security team. 

The bot has also prepared a report for the suspicious connections utilizing your software

[PIECES_OS_GITHUB_ISSUE_PUBLIC.md](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22247971/PIECES_OS_GITHUB_ISSUE_PUBLIC.md)

I should mention the kernel on my machine is compromised and this is after a factory restore and wiping of the hard drives. It's an ongoing issue, but wanted to alert you as best I could

. I suspect attackers exploited vulnerabilities in the past, leading to frequent factory restores every two to three months for the past four years. As an IT professional, I know what to look for, but these attacks have made me rethink my defenses. Despite this, I’m doing my best to protect my home network from such attacks.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the Pieces OS and Desktop app startup failures as this is the most frequent and impactful issue.
Investigate the root cause of the startup failures, focusing on potential data corruption, service hangs, and update compatibility issues.
Provide clear communication and updates to users experiencing startup issues, including workarounds or temporary fixes.
Develop more robust testing and quality assurance processes for Pieces OS and Desktop updates to prevent similar issues in the future.
Improve error handling and logging within the Pieces OS and Desktop app to facilitate faster diagnosis and resolution of problems.
Consider creating dedicated troubleshooting guides or FAQs for common startup issues.
Monitor the MCP Server SSE connection issue and its impact on Claude Code integration.
Investigate suspicious connection reports and ensure the security of the Pieces platform.
